scenario: Not violated. The pointer 'answerstring' is assigned the result of malloc and is later written into via snprintf. Rule 8.13 requires pointers to be const-qualified only when the pointed-to data will not be modified; here the buffer is intentionally mutable, so declaring it as 'char *' is correct and does not violate MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13.
